summary: like no offense to people who believe the show is following the books but how can sansa leave the vale, end up on the wall, meet...
body: like no offense to people who believe the show is following the books but how can sansa leave the vale, end up on the wall, meet a resurrected jon, travel all over the north (which stannis did btw. that’s where the northern men in his army came from), convince littlefinger to come north with the vale army, have a battle and win the battle in a book with 20 pov characters especially when stannis already had that storyline in adwd? like it makes no sense to me. jon and sansa’s storyline in season 6 was stannis’ storyline in book 5. why would george repeat himself? where is the thematic satisfaction in that? stannis isn’t killing shireen either because he charged his knights to put her on the iron throne if he dies and because she’s at the wall protected by the queen’s men. jon and sansa will meet again without a doubt but they have separate storylines that are very important to their arcs.

summary: so years ago i tried getting my sibling into game of thrones but they watched the first 3 episodes and got bored. now, years...
body:
so years ago i tried getting my sibling into game of thrones but they watched the first 3 episodes and got bored. now, years later, very very surprisingly they’ve watched every episode three times over, memorised the entire map of westeros and essos, and is now near-fluent in valyrian due to duolingo

..

what the fuck

summary:
New level of hysteria 
“Probably Jon Loves Dany  But he betrayed Ygritte . He choice Duty. He will betray Dany too.”
Sorry but...
body:
New level of hysteria

“Probably Jon Loves Dany But he betrayed Ygritte . He choice Duty. He will betray Dany too.”


Sorry but this people are so stupid or they are just trying to be original or different?


“Love is a death of duty Lord Snow”_Maester Armon

If Ygritte was His love why he choice a duty?

Especially Jon never ever said in bookthat he loved Ygritte. He never ever said to Ygritte “I love you “.


And if we believe to author it was very symbolic moment.

summary:
Sometimes I think the supposed sexism in "nerd culture" is overblown.
Then I go to Youtube to watch the Brienne of Tarth vs...
body:
Sometimes I think the supposed sexism in “nerd culture” is overblown.

Then I go to Youtube to watch the Brienne of Tarth vs Hound fight from Game of Thrones and see that it is the ONLY fight in the entire series where people will BITTERLY complain about the result, throw around words like “biology,” and throw up a six paragraph “analysis” on why that result would be TOTES impossible in real life. Typed out from someone who, like me, has almost certainly never been in an actual fight in their lives.

reblog.comment:
